name: algo: jwt-sign
algo: jwt-verify
info:
## input:
on msg.sub assign an a token string like this:


    'eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiI...'


## output:
inside msg.sub:



    {
        token: 'eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiI...',
        decoded: {},
        error: {
            message: 'jwt expired',
            stack: '',
            arguments: null,
            name: 'TokenExpiredError',
            expiredAt: '2023-02-19T07:49:01.000Z'
        }  
    }

// nrlint function-eslint:off

name: algo: hashing
info:
## Input
set msg.sub with the password string that neet to be hashing

    `MyPassword`

## Output
it will produce msg.sub a hasing string

    ``

// nrlint function-eslint:off

name: algo: hashing-compare
algo: crypto-encrypt
info:
## Input
set msg.sub into a string that want to encrypt

    msg.sub = "some random text"

## output
it will produce encrypted text in msg.sub

// nrlint function-eslint:off

name: algo: crypto-dencrypt
info:
## Input
assign msg.sub with encrypted text like:

    msg.sub = "d15cac3ea87e3fca0b51b"

## output
it will produce dencrypted text in msg.sub

// nrlint function-eslint:off

name: sub: search-on-hierarchy
info:
## Input on msg.sub

    msg.sub = {
        topic: 'area',
        root: 5001,
        pointer: 5068,
        crit: [
            {
                key: 'category',
                val: 'BLOCK'
            }
        ]
    }

`topic` is a topic for hierarchy in couchdb 

`root` is an id as starting point of all hierarchy tree 

`pointer` is starting point to search by id inside tree

`crit` as a filter to define the final result

## Output on msg.sub

    msg.sub = {
        result,
        parents,
        flatten
    }

`result` is the result after filter by criteria

`parents` contains all superior node starting from pointer id

`flatten` contains all flatten objects starting at pointer

name: sub: get-scope-by-code
info:
## Input
assign msg.sub with string scope code like this:

    "SC-SAW-SIAK-00001"

## output
it will an array of scopes in msg.sub

    [
        {
            "name": "UPSTREAM",
            "desc": "UPSTREAM",
            "category": "US",
            "id": 5001,
            "level": 0,
            "parentId": null
        },
        {
            "name": "DIRSERVICE",
            "desc": "Directorate Service",
            "category": "DIRECTORATE",
            "id": 5005,
            "level": 1,
            "parentId": 5001
        },
    ]

name: sub: redis-set
info:
## Input

msg.sub

    {
        key: msg.redisKey,
        payload: JSON.stringify(payload),
        ttl: Number(env.get('NODERED_TTL')) * 60
    }

name: mapping result
confirm
prompt: this process will overwriten smart-users data, are you sure ? yes / no

name: set query
func:
msg.topic = `
select
	tab.iOrgID,
	valRef.szValueRef as cCategory,
	tab.szOrgName as ChildName,
	tab.szDescription as ChildDesc,
	parent.iOrgID as ParentID,
	parRef.szValueRef as pCategory,
	parent.szOrgName as ParentName,
	parent.szDescription as ParentDesc
from
	digaportal.oa_organization tab
left join digaportal.oa_organization parent on
	tab.szParentOrgID = parent.iOrgID
left join digaportal.gn_valueref valRef on
	tab.iOrgCatID = valRef.iValueRefID
left join digaportal.gn_valueref parRef on
	parent.iOrgCatID = parRef.iValueRefID
order by
	tab.iOrgID
`;
return msg;

name: function 3
set query
func:
msg.topic = `
select
	szValueRef as label,
	szValueRefDescription as description,
	szCategory as category,
	szCategory2 as category2,
	szCategory3 as category3,
	szCategory4 as category4,
	szCategory5 as category5
from
	gn_valueref gv
order by
	szCategory,
	szCategory2,
	szCategory3,
	szCategory4,
	szCategory5
`;
return msg;

name: prepare & result
check sub
validate & prepare sub
validate
select oa_basemap
func:
let query = `
    SELECT
        base.iScope as id,
        case
            when base.iTypeMap = 1 then 'PSM'
            when base.iTypeMap = 2 then 'Estate'
            when base.iTypeMap = 3 then 'Road'
            when base.iTypeMap = 4 then 'Block'
            when base.iTypeMap = 5 then 'Mill'
            when base.iTypeMap = 6 then 'Division'
            else 'Complex'
        end as category,
        org.szOrgName as name,
        base.txtBasemap1 as geojson,
        base.txtProperties as props
    FROM
`;
query += '`app-portal-beta2`.oa_basemap base inner join `app-portal-beta2`.oa_organization org ON org.iOrgID = base.iScope order by base.iTypeMap';
msg.payload = null;
msg.topic = query;
return msg;
